3509203f-4f69-4471-a59b-491bd8abbb7b.description: Earners of this badge have completed a four week internship at Tees Valley Combined Authority within the Creative Place, Place Marketing or Education teams. They have developed knowledge and understanding of the organisation and an understanding of the creative and cultural industries sector in Tees Valley.
3509203f-4f69-4471-a59b-491bd8abbb7b.name: Internship - Tees Valley Combined Authority

issuer.summary: issued by Tees Valley Combined Authority and authorized by Badge Nation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badging Standard - Demonstrate layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Demonstrate Layer of the Cities of Learning Badging Standard. The earner has demonstrated they can apply knowledge with real world context and has gained experience, consistently and applied feedback they have received in order to develop.

badge_template_activities.title: Earner passed a competitive recruitment process by completing an application form and passing an interview.
Earner has completed an orientation and induction process that has made them aware of the TVCA’s role and operations to drive place based, economic regeneration in Tees Valley.

Earner has been introduced to and received feedback on their progress against TVCA values, these are; open – transparent, honest and receptive, collaborative – working in partnership to make it happen, empathetic – understanding, considerate and perceptive, focused – driven with clarity of purpose.
Earner has received basic training in GDPR, diversity, equality and inclusion. These have been accessed via online IHASCO modules and in person.
Earner has gained knowledge in the creative and cultural industries relevant to their role/team and wider knowledge specific to the team they are working with.

Earner has undertaken the following tasks - diary management, minuting of meetings, correspondence with stakeholders and been introduced to, and used, a variety of digital platforms including the full Office 365 suite and Teams/SharePoint and TVCA intranet.

Earner has worked to a role specific work package and received feedback on their progress. Earner has developed their knowledge & understanding of their area of work through independent and guided research and delivering required work & projects to deadlines.
Available by application only, please contact the provider for more information.
Teesside Airport Business Suite, Teesside International Airport, Darlington, County Durham, United Kingdom, DL2 1NJ

endorsements.description: City and Guilds endorse the Cities of Learning Badging Standard designed as a scaffold to recognise knowledge, skills and behaviour achievement developed in association with the RSA

f8b12d7a-0c26-4244-81be-8ac17a5dfe00.description: Earners of this badge have successfully completed the Animex Academy Stop Motion Workshop. They have worked in a team to write, script, model, film and direct a short animation film which has been screened to an audience.
f8b12d7a-0c26-4244-81be-8ac17a5dfe00.name: Animex Academy - Stop Motion Animation Workshop Participant

issuer.summary: issued by Tees Valley Combined Authority and authorized by Badge Nation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badging Standard - Participate Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Participation Layer of the Cities of Learning Badging Standard. The earner has met expectations, can interact with learning and is able to join in with others.

badge_template_activities.title: Earner has successfully created a stop-motion film demonstrating script writing, clay modelling, acting, directing, animation and creative digital skills.
Earner has worked effectively demonstrating teamwork skills and ability to plan a creative project.
Earner has demonstrated skills in communicating creative ideas and putting together a creative pitch.
Earner has demonstrated an understanding of the professional creative processes followed in industry and the careers opportunities available.
This badge is open to all.
Teesside University, Campus Heart, Southfield Rd, Middlesbrough TS1 3BX

endorsements.description: City and Guilds endorse the Cities of Learning Badging Standard designed as a scaffold to recognise knowledge, skills and behaviour achievement developed in association with the RSA

1115ce4b-259f-4ffb-bc7e-9225ad9f308a.description: Earners of this badge have successfully choreographed and showcased their own creations. Working collaboratively, earners have demonstrated knowledge of choreographic devices to structure choreography and add depth to their overall idea and make their own dance pieces.
1115ce4b-259f-4ffb-bc7e-9225ad9f308a.name: TeesDance - Young Choreographer

issuer.summary: issued by Tees Valley Combined Authority and authorized by Badge Nation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badging Standard - Demonstrate layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Demonstrate Layer of the Cities of Learning Badging Standard. The earner has demonstrated they can apply knowledge with real world context and has gained experience, consistently and applied feedback they have received in order to develop.

badge_template_activities.title: Earner created their own choreography that was showcased on a large stage in front of a live audience. Earner has demonstrated originality of movement for expressing the dance idea, mood, theme, feelings and music and selected appropriate movement material and developments that enhanced the meaning of the dance. Earner has demonstrated an understanding of choreographic devices to structure choreography and add depth through selection, manipulation and refinement of material.

Earner has worked collaboratively in a professional setting with professional artists to make choreography of artistic high-quality. Earner has demonstrated leadership in directing performers to create and develop dance material using excellent communication, facilitation and teaching skills.

Earner has taken part in a variety of choreographic workshops and creative processes to develop new skills of creativity, teamwork, leadership and time management. Earner can actively be reflective in their work, being able to identify areas of development and put measures in place to improve their work.

Earner has developed the knowledge and understanding to plan a project in a specific timescale with the ability to troubleshoot any challenges in meeting set deadlines. Earners can execute a final project from the initial idea to delivery to completion.

Earner can present their dance idea to their performers to ensure their dance idea, mood, theme, feelings and music is portrayed through selection, manipulation and refinement of material. Earner can present their own work by showcasing their own choreography to a paying live audience.
Available by application only, please contact the provider for more information.
Darlington Hippodrome, Parkgate, Darlington, DL1 1RR

endorsements.description: City and Guilds endorse the Cities of Learning Badging Standard designed as a scaffold to recognise knowledge, skills and behaviour achievement developed in association with the RSA
